intro: Lindernia brachiata, commonly known as the silverleaf lindernia, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in spikes at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments. Lindernia brachiata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to attract pollinators.
